file_intent.text: This file serves as the core component for loading essential data structures and handling queries in the application. It centralizes the data loading logic and query processing, ensuring that the application can efficiently respond to user requests. Deleting or rewriting this file could disrupt the entire data flow and query handling, leading to application failure.

responsibilities.label: Load PageRank Scores
responsibilities.description: Loads PageRank scores from a file into a global dictionary, which is critical for ranking documents in response to queries.

responsibilities.label: Load Inverted Index Data
responsibilities.description: Loads inverted index data from a file into global dictionaries, enabling efficient document retrieval based on query terms.

responsibilities.label: Initialize Data Loading
responsibilities.description: Calls the loading functions to populate global dictionaries, ensuring all necessary data is available before handling queries. This function is triggered during the application's initialization phase.

responsibilities.label: Process Query Hits
responsibilities.description: Processes incoming queries and returns document hits along with their scores, forming the primary interface for user requests. It is essential for user interaction with the application.

responsibilities.label: Manage Global State
responsibilities.description: Maintains global dictionaries (pagerank_dict, word_info_dict, doc_info_dict) that store loaded data, which is crucial for the application's performance and consistency. Modifying these variables requires caution due to potential side effects.

responsibilities.label: Handle Errors and Validations
responsibilities.description: Ensures that the hits function can manage errors or invalid query parameters, although additional error handling may be necessary to improve robustness.
